column4: How do I add a custom resolution to the nvidia settings app in Ubuntu/
'nvidia-settings'?
I guess. the x server settings up.
Yeah, it is.
there's a select/drop down for resolution there somewhere
There is, but there is no resolution I want :/
which do you want?
does it show up in the output of 'xrandr'?
let me check.
No.
you could try explicitly listing it in /etc/X11/xorg.conf
I believe I already did that.
Is it normal for it to say : # Removed Option "metamodes" "1440x900 +0+0"
probably, if it hates it :p
Is that not supposed to be there?
I mean, what do I do now?
what'd you add to xorg.conf?
I had previously added a few custom 'modes' below     SubSection     "Display"
mmm I forget the syntax, but the package should've come with some documentation in .html files which would explain it
I didn't find any.
well ask the channel how to find them
